title: Gabrielle Union claps back at online criticism of her family
text:
Dwyane Wade previously declared that the family he shares with wife Gabrielle Union support each other 'with Pride'.

And Union showed that pride on Tuesday, when she quickly shut down any hint of criticism stemming from a social media post Wade posted of his family.

The post in question showed his LA's Finest star wife with their 11-month-old daughter Kaavia and his 12-year-old son Zion, along with the caption 'MY GIRLS [HEART EMOJIS]'.

Shut down: Gabrielle Union, 46 [center], quickly shut down any hint of criticism stemming from a social media post Wade posted of his family on Tuesday. Seen with stepson Zion [L] and daughter Kaavia

One person had captured the image from Wade's Instagram Story and posted it on Twitter, along with the caption 'What y'all think about this?'

But the Bring It On star was quick to cut off any possible trolling.

'Looks like love to me [SHRUG EMOJI] I truly hope that everyone gets the love, support and hugs they deserve.'

Referring to her baby girl's fierce look, she added, 'Also Kaav ain't with the dumb s**t. Peace & blessings good people.'

The post: One person had captured the image from Wade's Instagram Story and posted it on Twitter, along with the caption 'What y'all think about this?'

Wearing it with pride: Union and Wade took all their kids to support Zion at the Miami Pride parade this Spring

Union and Wade took all their kids to support Zion at the Miami Pride parade this Spring.

Dwyane shared a photo from the parade with Union, Zion, his 17 year old brother Zaire and even baby Kaavia, plus other family friends.

Zaire posted a photo with him and Zion on his own Instagram story, stating, 'Gotcha back kid. Support gang!'

Wade shared that image on his own Instagram story, stating, 'Zion had his [own] cheering section today. Wish I was there to see you smile kid! It's a family thing.'
description: Gabrielle Union, 46, quickly shut down any hint of criticism stemming from a social media post Wade posted of his family on Tuesday.
